IMPORTANT:THIS PAGE PROVIDES GENERAL INFORMATION ABOUT THE PRIVACY POLICY OF THIS WEBSITE. IF YOU ARE UNDER 18 YEARS OF AGE, PLEASE BE SURE TO READ THIS PRIVACY POLICY WITH YOUR PARENTS OR GUARDIAN AND ASK QUESTIONS ABOUT THINGS YOU DO NOT UNDERSTAND.

www.lumoslearning.com (herein referred to as Website) is owned, managed, and operated by Lumos Information Services, LLC (DBA Lumos Learning) (hereinafter referred to as Company or We or Us or Our) a Limited Liability Company registered in New Jersey, USA with the registered address at PO Box 1575, Piscataway, NJ 08855.

The Privacy Policy (hereinafter referred to as Policy) outlines the Company practices, policies, and procedures concerning the collection, use, and protection of personal information collected from the users of this Website, in whatever capacity they use this Website (herein referred to as User, You or Your). We are committed to protecting your online privacy while you use this Website as a visitor or registered user.

Lumos Learning uses student data for education-related purposes. Student identifiable data is never shared with any third parties without the consent of an authorized representative of the applicable school or district. Lumos Learning does not sell or share any student data nor use any student data for targeted advertising.

This Policy and Our privacy practices in pursuance thereof are consistent with the relevant means Federal, State, Local, and Municipal laws and regulations in the United States including but not limited to, State privacy laws of California, Virginia, Colorado, Utah and Connecticut, specifically for residents of these States, that relate to the privacy, data protection or data security of your Personally Identifiable Information. We are signatories to the
, a voluntary standard but legally binding industry pledge to safeguard student privacy regarding the collection, maintenance, and use of student personal information.

By using this Website or any features thereof, you understand, acknowledge, and agree to the clause(s) and sub-clause(s) contained hereinafter. In case you do not agree to any of the following clause(s) or sub-clause(s), you understand, acknowledge, and agree that your sole remedy against the Company is the cessation of further use of this Website.
This Policy is incorporated by reference within Our
and shall be read in conjunction with the said
This policy describes the use of personal information in connection with products and services sold by Lumos Learning, its apps, and the use of the company website unless otherwise listed below.
1.1 Activities not covered by this Privacy Policy are:

Personal information that may be collected or used by other businesses when you click on third-party links found on our website or use social media widgets that we provide. You can refer to the privacy policy of third-party websites and services for information about their privacy practices.
2. Personally identifiable Information (PII) or Personal Information, Collection, Non-Collection, and Usage:
2. Personally identifiable Information (PII) or Personal Information, Collection, Non-Collection, and Usage:

Our sole objective is to provide You with timely, efficient, high quality content and collaborative learning platforms with personalized services (Wherever required), by leveraging innovations in digital and print media and enable you to better achieve Your Learning Objectives and experience.

Lumos Learning adopts the practice of minimizing the use, collection, and retention of Personally identifiable information as a basic privacy principle. We are aligned to “Minimum necessary principle”, whereby, we limit PII collections to the least amount necessary to conduct our business and achieve our objectives. Lumos Learning carefully considers the total amount of PII used, collected, and maintained, as is necessary to achieve its objectives.

We do not collect any Sensitive Personal Data or Information, from any user of this Website. During the online registration process, We ask for your Name, and email id at the time of registration. We send log-in credentials to such registered members for a secure access to our Website. Once registered, You can access the Member Area by keying in your login id and the corresponding password.

4.1 In order to become a registered member of this Website, You are required to fill and submit an online Registration Form. Through this Registration Form, We collect certain personally identifiable information from You including, but not limited to, Name, email id, login name, password.

4.2 Besides the Registration Form, We may collect the personally identifiable information such as your name, email id, phone number (Phone number is Optional data, voluntary disclosure by you), or any part thereof, from the Survey Forms, Referral Forms, Newsletters Subscription Forms, Invitation Forms, Sweepstakes/Competitions/Contests Forms, or any other promotional or research activities undertaken by the Company and which necessitate the collection of such personally identifiable information.

4.3 The Online programs can be purchased by the Schools, Educators or Parents. Based on the Online programs purchased, the personal information collected will include (i) school administrators’ names, contact information and Login Information, (ii) teachers’ names,, contact information and Login Information, (iii) identifying information about students provided by the school administrator or teacher or parents, for e.g. students’ names solely for the purpose of tracking and gathering data regarding such students’ use of various products of our company, (iv) parents’ names and contact information provided by the parent themselves or school administrator or teacher, solely for reference, and (v) credit card information, debit card information, PayPal information, as the case may be.
4.4 We also collect usage information through technology, such as cookies, as further explained in Section 13 below.

4.5 We may obtain certain information through your social media or other online accounts if they are connected to your Lumos Learning account. If you log in to our account via Google, Clever, or any other third-party platform or service, we ask for your permission to access certain information about that other account. For example, depending on the platform or service, we may collect your name, login email address, location, physical location of your access devices.

4.6 Those platforms and services make information available to us through their APIs. The information we receive depends on what information you (via your privacy settings) or the platform or service decide to give us.

4.7 If you access or use our Services through a third-party platform or service, or click on any third-party links, the collection, use, and sharing of your data will also be subject to the privacy policies and other agreements of that third party.
4.8 We use Alexa and Google Assistant (virtual assistants) through which you may place requests and commands in your school accounts.

4.9 We do not collect any other personal information about Users except when such Users specifically provide personal information on a voluntary basis (for example user name and password, login information) in connection with a request for technical support, whether by email or phone request or when personal information is provided on behalf of an individual. Personally identifiable information may also be collected from website users in the process of search queries and other support activities and may include but is not limited to log-in information, IP address, device information.

4.10 We do not collect any other personal information about Users except when such Users specifically provide personal information on a voluntary basis (for example user name and password, login information) in connection with a request for technical support, whether by email or phone request or when personal information is provided on behalf of an individual. Personally identifiable information may also be collected from website users in the process of search queries and other support activities and may include but is not limited to log-in information, IP address, device information.

4.11 Parents or legal guardians can also purchase the Lumos Learning Online program. If a child is below the age of 13 years, as a parent or guardian, by purchasing the program you agree that you are providing the consent to your child to use the Lumos Learning online program.
5. Our Compliance with Data privacy protection Statues:
5. Our Compliance with Data privacy protection Statues:

5.1 We understand that Users who are under 13 years of age (“Children”) need special safeguards and privacy protection, and it is the intent of the Company to fully comply with, though not limited to, COPPA (Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act), FERPA (Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act), the California Student Online Personal Information Protection Act (SOPIPA), the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), the California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA) and all other applicable state or federal student data privacy protection laws. Company does not collect personal information directly from children online at any point. Company only receives personal information about children directly from school administrators and/or teachers or parents when they set up Student accounts. Parents or legal guardians should contact their child’s school to review any personal information regarding their children that the school’s administrators or teachers have provided to the Company.

5.2 COPPA permits a school, acting in the role of “parent,” to provide required consent regarding the Personal Information of students who are under the age of 13. Where a school is a subscriber to our Products, we rely on this form of COPPA consent. We provide the school with this Policy, to ensure that the school, in providing its COPPA consent, has full information and assurance that our practices comply with COPPA.

5.3 FERPA permits a school to provide educational records (including those that contain students’ Personal Information) to certain service providers without requiring the school to obtain specific parental consent. FERPA permits this where the service provider acts as a type of “school official” by performing services, for example, that would otherwise be performed by the school’s own employees. We fulfill FERPA requirements for qualifying as a school official by, among other steps, giving the school direct control with respect to the use and maintenance of the education records at issue (including associated personal information), and refraining from re-disclosing or using this Personal Information except for purposes of providing our Products to the school. We comply with FERPA by relying on this form of consent.

5.4 If you are an educator or a School Administrator and you add a student who is under 13 to your class within the Lumos Learning Online Program, you acknowledge and agree that you are solely responsible for compliance with the COPPA, FERPA and SOPIPA guidelines, including, but not limited to, obtaining parental consent concerning collection of students’ personal information used in connection with the provisioning and use of Lumos Learning Online Program.

5.5 SOPIPA permits use of student information only for educational purposes, thereby Lumos Learning is committed to protect the privacy and security of student data and thereby expressly prohibits the use of such student data for targeted advertising and selling. We fulfill SOPIPA requirements, we do not sell, share students’ data or create students’ profile from students’ data to third parties. Further we do not send any advertisements to the parents of students by using their data for non-educational purposes.
6. Your rights over your personal information:
6. Your rights over your personal information:
6.1 Right to access your personal information:
Upon request, we will grant you access to your personal information that you provided us, unless there is third party information, as disclosing such information shall violate their privacy rights.
6.2 Right to rectify your personal data:

6.2.1 All the personally identifiable information so collected is available for review and revision in Your Member Area. You can, at any time, review and/or change such personally identifiable information, which is incorrect or inaccurate or has turned obsolete. However, You understand, acknowledge and agree that We shall not be liable for the authenticity of any personally identifiable information You provide at any time.

6.2.2 Please be informed that we may not be able to approve your request to update/change your personal information if we believe such request would violate any law or legal requirement. Proper access and use of information provided on the Lumos Learning Website, including User submissions, is governed by our Terms of Use.
6.3 Right to remove your personal data provided by you to the company:

6.3.1 We collect only reasonable amount of personally identifiable information in order to provide You with efficient and timely services. However, should You choose not to provide Us with the requested personally identifiable information, You understand, acknowledge and agree that You don’t have any actionable claim in this regard against the Company and the Company shall not be obligated to deliver the requested services in the absence of the provision of the requested personally identifiable information.
6.3.2 To have your personally identifiable information, which you’ve shared with us, removed, simply send an email to
7. Use of your Personally identifiable information:
7. Use of your Personally identifiable information:

7.1 We collect only reasonable amount of personally identifiable information in order to provide You with efficient and timely services. However, should You choose not to provide Us with the requested personally identifiable information, You understand, acknowledge and agree that You don’t have any actionable claim in this regard against the Company and the Company shall not be obligated to deliver the requested services in the absence of the provision of the requested personally identifiable information.

7.2 We only send newsletters, latest offers, news, and updates to subscribers who opt to receive the newsletter. If You do not want Us to contact You for this purpose, You can opt-out by clicking the Unsubscribe link that is included in all Our similar emails.
7.3 We may send certain communications to Your postal address, which are required by law to be communicated via offline mode as well.

7.4 We allow the option to share certain website details on social media like Facebook, twitter, LinkedIn or Google plus in order to help You share and stay connected with Your network of friends on these popular media.

7.5 As a registered member of this Website, You are also provided with the facility to post blogs on the Website, which are publicly accessible to all visitors to this Website. While We reserve the right to moderate all such blog posts for compliance with Our Terms of Use Agreement, We shall not be liable for any such blog post that may compromise the poster’s online privacy. Consequently, You may use Your Pet Name or real name within the blog post, but We disclaim any liability arising out of all such disclosures by the users voluntarily.

7.6 We are constantly working to improve the Artificial Intelligence (hereinafter, “AI Services”) generated content to make them more accurate, reliable, safe and beneficial. We have made every effort to provide the most accurate information possible; sometimes AI may provide inaccurate or offensive content that does not represent Lumos Learning’s views. Use discretion before relying on, publishing or otherwise using content provided by AI.

THE AI SERVICES ARE PROVIDED “AS IS.” EXCEPT TO THE EXTENT PROHIBITED BY LAW, WE AND OUR AFFILIATES AND LICENSORS MAKE NO WARRANTIES (EXPRESS, IMPLIED, STATUTORY OR OTHERWISE) WITH RESPECT TO THE SERVICES, AND DISCLAIM ALL WARRANTIES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, SATISFACTORY QUALITY, NON-INFRINGEMENT, AND QUIET ENJOYMENT, AND ANY WARRANTIES ARISING OUT OF ANY COURSE OF DEALING OR TRADE USAGE. WE DO NOT WARRANT THAT THE AI SERVICES WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED, ACCURATE OR ERROR FREE, OR THAT ANY CONTENT WILL BE SECURE OR NOT LOST OR ALTERED.

7.7 In the event you provide a feedback to Our website or leave a testimonial for Us, We shall treat all the personal information contained in such feedback/testimonial in accordance with the provisions contained herein.

7.8 We ask your email id in case of Forgotten password to reset your password. You are advised to change the password after logging into your id using the temporary password provided as per the suggestion in our mail. In case the account has been created using Username and not email id, we take necessary account details over phone for resetting the password. We treat this as personal information and is treated in accordance with the provisions contained herein.
7.9 Our Customer Success team might periodically review your usage data to provide Consultation, if need be.
7.10 Only that much personal information is collected from you as is absolutely vital to provide You with efficient and timely services.

7.11 Your personal information may be shared without consent or notice to meet legal requirements pursuant to applicable law or government request, to detect fraud and/or to prevent harm to other users or public.

8.1 We may disclose personal information that we collect or you provide as described in this privacy policy to contractors we use to support our business and who are bound by contractual obligations to keep personal information confidential and use it only for the purposes for which we disclose it to them or as expressly stated herein.

8.2 We may also disclose personal information to a buyer or other successor entity in the event of a merger, divestiture, restructuring, reorganization, dissolution, or other sale or transfer of some or all of Lumos Learning’s assets, whether as a going concern or as part of bankruptcy, liquidation, or similar proceeding, in which personal information held by Lumos Learning about the company Website users is among the assets transferred.

8.3 We may also disclose your personal information to comply with any court order, law, or legal process, including to respond to any government or regulatory request, to enforce our Terms of Use, or if we believe disclosure is necessary or appropriate to protect the rights, property, or safety of Lumos Learning, our customers, or others.
9. Our commitment to Data Security and Information on Security Procedures:
9. Our commitment to Data Security and Information on Security Procedures:
9.1 Standard of Care. Keep and maintain all Personal Information in strict confidence, using such degree of care as is appropriate to avoid unauthorized access, use, modification, or disclosure;

9.2 Non-Disclosure. Not, directly or indirectly, disclose Personal Information to any person other than our employees and Our Service Providers who have a need to know, without Your express written consent;
9.3 Employee Training. Provide appropriate privacy and information security training to our employees.
9.4 Transport Security. Use Transport Layer Security (TLS) for our transmission of all user data to and from our Products; and

9.5 All Your personally identifiable information so collected is kept confidential and never shared with, or sold to, or otherwise commercially traded with, any third party without Your prior express written consent. However, We may share all or part of such personally identifiable information with trusted third party providers and/or suppliers who work on Your behalf in order to provide You with efficient and timely services in compliance with our Privacy Policy and any other appropriate confidentiality and security measures. However, all such third party providers and/or suppliers are under the appropriate burden of confidentiality not to share, disclose, or independently use any of the personally identifiable information so collected.

9.6 Secure Storage. We use industry-standard file encryption for user data wherever applicable and feasible. Where file encryption is not reasonably feasible, we employ other industry standard safeguards, protections, and countermeasures to protect such data, including authentication and access controls within media, applications, operating systems and equipment.

9.7 We have implemented and maintain reasonable organizational, technical, administrative, and physical security controls that are designed to protect the security, confidentiality, and integrity of personal information collected through our Website and Products from unauthorized access, disclosure, use, loss, or modification.

9.8 Our information security controls comply with reasonable and accepted industry practice, as well as requirements under COPPA, FERPA, SOPIPA and all other applicable Federal, State, Municipal and Local laws. We diligently follow these information security controls and periodically review and test our information security controls to keep them current.

9.9 To Prevent unauthorized access, maintain data accuracy, and ensure the correct use of Information, Company has put in place commercially reasonable physical, electronic and managerial procedures to safeguard and secure the information Company collects. Company also uses Secure Socket Layer (SSL) protocol on registration and login pages to protect personal information.
9.10 For Purchase of products from our Website, we ask for Credit Card number. These transactions are secured using licensed secure server software which encrypts the information you provide.

9.11 Additionally, we periodically review our operations and business practices for compliance with corporate policies and procedures governing the security, confidentiality and quality of our information.

9.12 The security of your personal information is very important to us. We have implemented a reasonable physical, administrative and technological safeguards that are designed to preserve the integrity and security of the personal information we collect and to protect against unauthorized access to data. These include internal reviews of our data collection, storage, and processing practices and security measures, as well as physical security measures to guard against unauthorized access to systems where we store personal data. We restrict access to personal information to Lumos Learning employees, contractors, and agents who need to know that information in order to operate, develop, or improve our services. Our employees may be subject to disciplinary action, including termination, if they fail to meet privacy and confidentiality obligations. However, no security system is fool proof; for that reason, we cannot guarantee the security of your personal information. If personal information under our control is compromised as a result of a breach of security, we will take reasonable steps to investigate the situation and take all steps required by applicable laws and regulations and our agreements with any affected Schools.

9.13 Maintaining the security of your personal information also requires your cooperation and involvement. For your protection, remember to sign out of all accounts before closing your browser. There is a sign out link available on all our pages. After signing out, make sure to close all browser windows. In addition, do not use the “Remember” feature if you are signing in to your account from a computer that other persons may have access to. This is to ensure that others cannot access your personal information if you share a computer with someone else or are using a public computer.

9.14 Please keep your password secure. If you have forgotten your password, you may request a new one by contacting support@lumoslearning.com. A new password will be sent to the e-mail address you specified during registration.

9.15 Parents or legal guardians can request their Children’s school not to provide any personal information through their Student account to Company. Please be aware that, depending on the school’s policies, if a parent or legal guardian makes such a request, their Children may no longer be eligible to be enrolled in Company programs. Therefore, such a request by a parent or legal guardian could potentially terminate their Children’s participation in and their use of Company programs.

9.16 As a parent, you understand that any personally identifiable information that your child provides in connection with registration or otherwise may be used by Us as provided in this Privacy Policy. Except where the context indicates otherwise, the remainder of this Privacy Policy (including any discussion of the personally identifiable information that we may collect, use or disclose) shall apply equally to a Child User account and an account for someone over 13.

9.17 If you have any concerns about the security of your account or the security of the Service, we ask that you report your concern to us immediately at support@lumoslearning.com. While we are unable to respond to all security concerns, we appreciate your feedback and take all reported concerns seriously.

10.1 We do not as a rule allow third-party operators to collect Personal Information through persistent identifiers on our Products for any purpose other than the internal operations, support, and maintenance of our Products. Further, we do not use or permit third parties to use, Personal Information collected through our Products for the purpose of targeted advertising.

10.2 We may use aggregated information that does not permit the identification of any individual User or Customer for analytics purposes, to understand how our Products are accessed and used, and how they perform, so that we may improve upon their design and functionality and otherwise develop and improve upon our products and services, and to develop analytics studies. We may disclose these studies to third parties, including to demonstrate product efficacy;

10.3 We de-identify usage information in accordance with applicable Federal, State, Local and Municipal laws including COPPA, FERPA, and SOPIPA. We use this de-identified information, in order to develop, evaluate, and provide improved educational products and services, as permitted under COPPA and FERPA. To the extent we collect information that constitutes Performance Review Data, we protect such information as Personal Information in accordance with this Policy.
11. Non Personally identifiable Information – Collection and Usage:
11. Non Personally identifiable Information – Collection and Usage:

11.1 When You visit different pages of this Website, We also collect certain non personally identifiable information including, but not limited to, the type of browser used to access this Website, Internet Protocol (IP) Address of Your computer system, IP address of Your Internet Service Provider (ISP), the operating system installed on Your computer system, etc.

11.2 We use non personally identifiable information to improve the layout and content of Our Website, provide You with customized advertisements, analyse the Website usage, and enhance Your overall experience of using this Website.

We use cookies to collect the aforementioned non personally identifiable information from the users of this Website. Cookies are small text files that are placed on the hard drive of Your computer system by a Web page server. The cookies are meant to determine such information as: how You use Our Website, how You use Our services in general, types of data accessed, time and volume of use, duration of sessions and other similar usage. The cookies are also used to avoid repeat login while the session is still open. Our cookies do not, in any way, compromise on Your online privacy or damage Your computer system in any manner whatsoever. However, You shall be solely responsible for regularly clearing cookies, cached data and temporary internet files from Your computer system in order to manage the downloaded data, if any.

Company may offer private messaging to certain registered Users. Users should be aware that any information posted in these forums will be received by the specified User’s account. Company has no obligation to monitor the private messaging system. Company reserves the right, however, at all times to disclose any information as necessary to satisfy any law, regulation or governmental request, or to edit, or remove any information or materials, in whole or in part, that in the sole discretion of Company are objectionable or in violation of this privacy policy or the terms and conditions governing the User’s use of the Website.

14.1 Website may contain links to other Web sites, chat rooms, or other resources that Company provides for Users’ convenience (the “Linked Sites”). The Linked Sites are not under the control of Company, and Company is not responsible for the content available on any Linked Site. The Linked Sites do not imply the endorsement of material from Company on any Linked Site, and Company expressly disclaims all liability with regard to Users’ access to such Linked Sites. Access to any Web sites linked to Company is at Users’ own risk.

14.2 At our discretion, we may include or offer Third Party Products or Services on our Website. These Third Party services may have separate and independent Privacy Policies. We, therefore, have no liability or responsibility for the content and activities of these linked sites.

Neither Lumos Learning, nor any of its subsidiary or affiliated corporations will be liable for any damages (including special or consequential damages) or injury caused by any failure of performance, error, omission, interruption, defect, delay in operation of transmission, computer virus, Data breach, communication line failure, theft or destruction, or unauthorized access to or alteration of, this web site, or the contents in it.

We reserve the right, in our sole discretion, to amend and update this Policy or any part thereof at any time. We shall notify any major amendment(s) in the Policy by a notice requesting perusal on the homepage, which shall run for fifteen (15) days from such amendment(s). All such amendment(s) and updates shall come into effect immediately upon posting on the Website page. You are, therefore, advised to visit this Website page periodically to remain informed about the latest changes affected to this Policy. Your continued usage of this Website constitutes your implied acceptance of the amended Privacy Policy.

Any dispute or claim relating in any way to your use of any of our services or products, or to any products or services accessed through lumoslearning.com will be resolved by binding arbitration, rather than in court, except that you may assert claims in small claims court if your claims qualify. The Federal Arbitration Act and federal arbitration law apply to this agreement. The arbitration will be conducted by the American Arbitration Association (AAA) under its rules, including the AAA’s Supplementary Procedures for Consumer-Related Disputes. We each agree that any dispute resolution proceedings will be conducted only on an individual basis and not in a class, consolidated or representative action. If for any reason a claim proceeds in court rather than in arbitration we each waive any right to a jury trial.

By using any of our Services or Products, you agree that the Federal Arbitration Act, applicable federal law, and the laws of the state of New Jersey, without regard to principles of conflict of laws, will govern these Conditions of Use and any dispute of any sort that might arise without giving effect to any Conflict of Laws provisions. We do not claim that this Website or the Services or Products offered on or through this Website are appropriate, legal, or available for use in other locations. Accordingly, Your use of this Website is at Your own sole risk. You assume all knowledge of the applicable law and shall be responsible for compliance with any such law(s).
